page.title: 08ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: In Dunfermline for our entertainment we have halls, a cinema, discos, bingo and travelling shows. The Carnegie Hall stages plays, operas and pantomimes performed by local groups and suitable for all ages. It has a Saturday morning club for children to enjoy. The hall is rarely closed and is a great attraction for visitors to the town. Dunfermline has only one cinema, the "Orient Express" but it shows three films every night except Wednesday. It is easy to find a good seat and it is never too full. The films showing are listed in our local paper, "The Dunfermline Press". Bingo is another popular form of adult entertainment. Of the two halls available in the town, the "Alhambra" is the most popular. It used to be a famous playhouse and people from all
